subject: Ex-Gratia amount to the kins of workers looking their life due to accident at work site.
text: HRd <4tv TTTHT gfaqrrut TMI /Phone: 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Ws0 @Rae7t &r rnoTHM #ATq4) 447 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 AT National Highways Authority of India QA: Extn:: 2223 2318 2488 2553 (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) ii-5 U 6, #ver-10, ETaT;, #frrit_ 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn: 8th March 2011 POLICY MATTER ~ Technical (74/2011 (Decisions taken Tamil Nadu Division FNo.NHAI/BOT/11012/50/2005) Subject: Ex-gratia amount to the kins of Workers loosing their life due to accident at work site. A case has come to the notice that ex-gratia amount to be paid by the Concessionaire has not reached the kins Of the deceased even after a lapse of more than one month. 2. It is also noticed that considerable time is required by the Regional Labour Commissioner for verification of the family details of the deceased worker. 3 Manual of Specifications and Standards for Four Laning of Highways IRC-SP-84-2009 also provides for compensation scheme including: A compensation scheme including insurance cover for third party for workers, road Users and road side residents in case of death/injury/damage to the vehiclelproperty/resulting from accidents on the Project Highway, irrespective of the person at fault should be proposed by the Concessionaire. 4 It has been decided that the Contractor/Concessionaire must have a system in place to maintain data base of all workers employed by the Contractor/Concessionaire with their bio-data having details of their permanent address, details of their family next of kin declaration to ensure that ex-gratia amount to the kins of the deceased workers is released within 48 hours: Contd:..2/- HT 7 7 NHAL
